head.title: Frequently Asked Questions about Artesyn's PM/PPC boards

sect3.title: About this FAQ
sect3.para: Here are some frequently asked questions (and answers) about Artesyn's PM/PPC boards.
This FAQ is very much a work in progress. If you have additional information, questions, or answers, send mail to port-powerpc@NetBSD.org.

sect3.title: How do I boot &os;?
sect3.para: &os; is booted over the network. You need two things: a TFTP server to load the kernel image and an NFS server for the file systems.

The &os; kernel has been relocated for loading at address 0x40000, so the Artesyn monitor has to be set up for this load address. Use the monitor commands nvdisplay and nvupdate to configure the boot parameters, and boottftp to boot.

sect3.title: Can &os; configure the PCI devices?
sect3.para: &os; can configure the PCI devices if the option PCI_NETBSD_CONFIGURE is used. This may not work if the firmware also configures the devices. The firmware configuration can be turned off using nvdisplay.

sect3.title: Can the &os; kernel be flashed?
sect3.para: Yes, the same kernel that is booted over TFTP can be flashed. The steps are:

Use nvdisplay to make sure that CopyToLoadAdr is set, that RomBase=70000000, and that RomSize is large enough to copy the whole kernel.
